span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 adj. 昏暗的，肮脏的： darkened with smoke and grime; dirty or discolored.
【例】 A dingy room is always Dickensian image of the poor.
【例】 The bed sheets were pretty dingy so we threw them in the laundry pile堆.
【近】 darkened, dirty, bedraggled, bemired, besmirched, dusty, mucky, muddy, nasty, smudged, soiled, sordid, stained, sullied
【反】 clean, cleanly, immaculate, spotless, stainless, unsoiled, unstained, unsullied 干净的
【记】 音：顶饥，最需要顶饥的是那些要饭的，肮脏，面色无光，破烂的；音：钉紧， 钉紧的(房子)里是肮脏，破旧，变色的，因为已经长久不用了
